title: NestedScrollView — Quick Demo
bullets: Flexible header that collapses while inner content keeps scrolling
Ideal for gallery or content apps that need a prominent hero area
Small API surface, big UX gain
image_prompt: hero slide: simple clean presentation title, soft milk background, subtle cream accent, small circular avatar in top-right, large centered headline
image_alt: Title slide with headline and small avatar
speaker_notes: Intro: Briefly say what we aim to show — keeping an expressive header while letting content take the stage. Time: 15-25s

title: Problem & Motivation
bullets: Large headers show artwork/branding but waste space when content is primary
Pinned headers keep context but reduce visible content
We want a header that is prominent when needed and yields space when not
image_prompt: diagram: header area that expands then collapses; mobile phone mockup with header then tiled content below; minimal, vector-style illustration
image_alt: Illustration of an expanding header and inner tiles
speaker_notes: Explain the UX tradeoff on mobile: when to show a large header and why collapsing helps. Time: 40-60s

title: Architecture
bullets: Outer scroll: SliverAppBar inside a NestedScrollView
Inner scrollables: TabBarView / ListView / GridView — independent scrolls
NestedScrollView coordinates outer slivers and inner scroll positions
image_prompt: flow diagram: SliverAppBar -> NestedScrollView -> TabBarView -> ListView, clean icons and arrows, neutral colors
image_alt: Architecture flow: SliverAppBar to inner scrolls
speaker_notes: Walk the diagram: show how the outer header maps to SliverAppBar and how inner tab views scroll independently but remain coordinated. Time: 50-70s

title: Key components
bullets: SliverAppBar — flexibleSpace, expandedHeight, pinned
NestedScrollView — headerSliverBuilder + body coordination
TabBarView / ListView / GridView — inner content panes
image_prompt: icons for SliverAppBar, NestedScrollView, TabBar, ListView arranged vertically with short labels, flat style
image_alt: Icons for the four main components
speaker_notes: Briefly define each API and its role. Point out where to customize behavior (expandedHeight, pinned, flexibleSpace). Time: 50-70s

title: Code: SliverAppBar (real snippet)
bullets: Shows how to create the collapsible header and attach a flexible space
Use safe network image/loading handlers for large artwork

code.content:
SliverAppBar(
  pinned: true,
  expandedHeight: 320,
  backgroundColor: Colors.transparent,
  elevation: 0,
  flexibleSpace: FlexibleSpaceBar(
    background: HeaderArtwork.light(), // use a local asset or omit the URL
  ),
)

image_prompt: small decorative code background: light textured card behind code, subtle
speaker_notes: Explain the snippet: expandedHeight sets how tall the header can be; pinned keeps the app bar visible once collapsed; flexibleSpace is where rich header artwork goes. Mention loading/error builders for network images. Time: 60-80s

title: Code: NestedScrollView + Tabs (real snippet)
bullets: Coordinates header slivers with inner TabBarView panes
Inner panes are regular scrollables (ListView / GridView)
image_prompt: minimal diagram next to code showing coordination between outer header and inner tabs
image_alt: Diagram showing NestedScrollView coordinating header and tabs
speaker_notes: Walk the headerSliverBuilder param, note that the body contains TabBarView and that each tab may host its own ListView/GridView. Time: 60-90s

title: Demo steps (what to show live)
bullets: Open on Gallery tab — point out the header artwork and title
Scroll slowly to show the header collapse and observe pin behaviour
Switch tabs and show inner lists/tiles that scroll independently
Scroll up to re-expand the header and show smooth reflow
image_prompt: sequence of four small frames showing the live demo steps: start, collapse, switch tab, re-expand
speaker_notes: Outline the live demo actions and timings; remind to scroll slowly for attendees to observe header transitions. Time (live demo): 90-120s

title: Takeaway & Resources
bullets: NestedScrollView + SliverAppBar provide an elegant way to keep headers expressive without sacrificing content space
Use flexibleSpace for artwork and provide image loading fallbacks
See the repo: lib/src/nested_scroll_demo.dart, header_artwork.dart, gallery_card.dart
image_prompt: clean resource card listing file paths and Flutter docs link, subtle
speaker_notes: Close by summarising the practical takeaway and link to the code in the repo. Offer to share the slide or code snippets after the talk. Time: 20-30s
